means: 用沙哑的声音或嗓音发音

word_mean: 喉，上通咽，下接气管，是呼吸出入之门户，也是发音器官。

sentence.Network_en: The taste of blood in her throat made her want to vomit.
sentence.Network_cn: 她嗓子里的血腥味让她直恶心。

sentence.Network_en: She took a sip of water to moisten her dry throat.
sentence.Network_cn: 她抿了一口水，润一下发干的喉咙。

sentence.Network_en: She wore a string of pearls at her throat.

jx.jx_en_mean: (of people or organizations) quarrel or fight persistently
jx.jx_cn_mean: （人，机构）激烈争吵，吵架；打架，斗殴

phrase.cizu_name: force (或 ram 或 shove) something down someone's thr

jx.jx_en_mean: force ideas or material on a person's attention by repeatedly putting them forward
jx.jx_cn_mean: 强迫某人接受；强行向某人灌输

phrase.cizu_name: grab (或 take) someone by the throat

jx.jx_en_mean: put one's hands around someone's throat, typically in an attempt to throttle them
jx.jx_cn_mean: 扼住某人的咽喉，掐住某人的脖子

jx.jx_en_mean: To compel to accept or consider

lj.lj_ly: always ramming his political opinions down my throat.
lj.lj_ls: 他常把自己的政治观念强加于我

phrase.cizu_name: ram down (someone's) throat 或 shove down (someone's) throat 【非正式用语】

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English throte, throtu, of Germanic origin; related to German Drossel. Compare with throttle

entry.def: Your throat is the back of your mouth and the top part of the tubes that go down into your stomach and your lungs.

example.ex: As she stared at him she felt her throat go dry.
example.tran: 她盯着他看的时候，感觉自己的喉咙发干。

entry.def: Your throat is the front part of your neck.

example.ex: His striped tie was loosened at his throat.
example.tran: 他的条纹领带松松地挂在脖子上。

entry.def: If you clear your throat, you cough once in order to make it easier to speak or to attract people's attention.

example.ex: Cross cleared his throat and spoke in low, polite tones.
example.tran: 克罗斯清了清嗓子，开始有礼貌地低声说话。

entry.tran: 向…反复灌输;向…不断强调;迫使…接受
entry.def: If you ram something down someone's throat or force it down their throat, you keep mentioning a situation or idea in order to make them accept it or believe it.

example.ex: I've always been close to my dad but he's never rammed his career down my throat...
example.tran: 我一直和爸爸很亲近，不过他从不强迫我继承他的事业。

example.ex: I can't understand why we're trying to ram Shakespeare down their throats.
example.tran: 我搞不懂我们为什么硬要他们学习莎士比亚的作品。

entry.def: If two people or groups are at each other's throats, they are quarrelling or fighting violently with each other.

example.ex: The idea that Billy and I are at each other's throats couldn't be further from the truth.
example.tran: 认为我和比利斗得你死我活的想法真是大错特错。

entry.def: If something sticks in your throat, you find it unacceptable.

example.ex: What sticks in my throat is that I wasn't able to win the trophy...
example.tran: 令我耿耿于怀的是自己没能获奖。

example.ex: She wanted to ask if he had news of Keith, but the words stuck in her throat.
example.tran: 她想问他有没有基思的消息，可是难以启齿。

means.word_mean: 1. the passage to the stomach and lungs; in the front part of the neck below the chin and above the collarbone
2. an opening in the vamp of a shoe at the instep
3. a passage resembling a throat in shape or function;

example.en: Pour me another of that throat gag, barkeeper.
example.zh: 洒吧老板，再给我倒一杯那种酒。

auth_sentence.content: Only once has she had a severe throat swelling.
auth_sentence.res_content: Only once has she had a severe throat swelling.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Only once has she had a severe throat swelling.

auth_sentence.content: There are white patches on his nape and throat.
auth_sentence.res_content: There are white patches on his nape and throat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There are white patches on his nape and throat.

auth_sentence.content: He had cut his throat, almost decapitating himself.
auth_sentence.res_content: He had cut his throat, almost decapitating himself.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He had cut his throat, almost decapitating himself.

jushi.english: He is suffering from an inflamed throat.
jushi.chinese: 他正承受着咽喉发炎之苦。

jushi.english: He cleared his throat as if to say something.
jushi.chinese: 他清了清嗓子,好像想说什么话似的。

jushi.english: She is wearing a brooch at the throat.
jushi.chinese: 她在颈前佩戴着一枚饰针。
